qas.question: What are the permanent sources of positive ecclesiastical law?
What are the impermanent sources of positive ecclesiastical law?

answers.text: changeable circumstantial and merely positive law

qas.question: What is given to the universal positive law of the Roman Catholic Church by its leader?
What is the pope's official title?
What three divisions of power often found in government does the pope hold?
What are the permanent sources of positive ecclesiastical law in all Christian churches?

plausible_answers.text: changeable circumstantial and merely positive law

qas.question: What are the impermanent sources of positive ecclesiastical law in all Christian churches?
What do all church leaders give to the universal positive law of the Roman Catholic Church?
What is the official title of all Cardinals?
What three powers usually found in government are held by the Pope and College of Cardinals?

context: In the Roman Church, universal positive ecclesiastical laws, based upon either <a0_0><b5_0>immutable divine and natural law<b5_0/><a0_0/>, or <a1_0><b6_0>changeable circumstantial and merely positive law<b6_0/><a1_0/>, derive <a2_0><b7_0>formal authority and promulgation<b7_0/><a2_0/> from the office of pope, who as <a3_0><b8_0>Supreme Pontiff<b8_0/><a3_0/> possesses the totality of <a4_0><b9_0>legislative, executive, and judicial<a4_0/> power<b9_0/> in his person. The actual subject material of the canons is not just doctrinal or moral in nature, but all-encompassing of the human condition.
